question: A 37-year-old man presents to the otorhinolaryngology clinic with the complaint of severe pain in his left ear. Examination reveals several vesicles on the tympanic membrane, meatal skin, and concha. What is the diagnosis?

A 9-year-old child is brought to your office with complaints of severe itching and pain in his right ear. Examination reveals a wet newspaper-like mass in the external ear. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 20-year-old male reports to the clinic after a flight with complaints of bilateral severe earache, deafness, and tinnitus. Otoscopy reveals bubbles in the middle ear across a retracted eardrum. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old male comes to your office with the complaint of a change in his voice. Fibre optic direct laryngoscopy (FODL) reveals paralyzed left vocal cord in paramedian position (unilateral abductor paralysis). Which of the following nerves is most likely affected in this patient?
A farmer develops long-standing late-stage atrophic rhinitis. Which of the following treatments is most preferable to eradicate the disease?

A 40-year-old male presents to your office with the complaint of a change in his voice. Fiber optic direct laryngoscopy reveals paralyzed left vocal cord in the paramedian position. Which of the following muscles is the main abductor of the vocal cords?

Noise is an undesirable and unwanted vibration of sound that can cause damage to humans both physically and mentally. The intensity of sound is measured in decibels (dB). Which of the following is the daily acceptable limit of noise that the human ear can tolerate without any substantial damage to hearing?
A mother brings in her 4-year-old boy to the clinic with complaints of severe right-sided earache, high-grade fever, and mild hearing impairment. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A farmer has developed a granuloma in his nose. Biopsy and histopathology of the granuloma reveal epitheliod necrotizing granuloma and vasculitis. Which of the following diseases has these features?

A 55-year-old woman comes to your office with the complaint of vertigo on turning her head to the right and while combing. Past history is relevant for a fall from the stairs around 5 years ago. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 17-year-old male presents to the emergency department with the complaint of bleeding from the nose after suffering a trauma. Which of the following is the most common site of epistaxis?

A 75-year-old lady comes to the clinic with the complaint of decreased hearing bilaterally. Her blood pressure is 145/98 mmHg and her ear examination is unremarkable. What is the most likely diagnosis?

Tuning fork tests were conducted on a 26-year-old woman. Rinne's test revealed that bone conduction was greater than air conduction in both of her ears. Weber's test was centralized and Schwabach's test was equal to that of the examiner in both ears. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for these findings?

A 24-year-old male visits the clinic with a complaint of a swelling in the floor of the oral cavity that ruptures and reappears on and off for the last 2 years. Oral examination reveals a transparent globular cystic swelling in the floor of the mouth. What is the most likely clinical diagnosis?
A 34-year-old female presents to the clinic with a history of dysphagia to solids for the past 3 years. Her hemoglobin is 7 mg/dl. What will be the most likely finding on a barium swallow?
What is the ideal frequency in Hertz for routine clinical tuning fork tests?

A neonate of one day of age has recurrent cyanosis and breathing difficulty. A mucoid discharge is noted inside the nasal cavity. Doctors suspect an upper respiratory tract infection, but there is no stridor or fever. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 6-year-old boy is brought to the clinic by his mother with complaints of nasal obstruction, nasal discharge, and bedwetting at night. On examination, the boy has an open-mouthed expression with prominent incisors. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 28-year-old female visits the outpatient department with complaints of restricted mouth opening, burning of the mouth, and intolerance to spicy food. She is habitual of chewing betel nuts for the last 12 years. Which premalignant condition is most likely to be present in this patient?

A 75-year-old lady reports to the emergency department with the complaint of dysphagia to solids following ingestion of her denture. She undergoes esophagoscopy under general anesthesia for removal of the foreign body. Following the removal, she starts complaining about sharp interscapular pain. Which of the following is the most dangerous complication of this procedure?

A 60-year-old man is suffering from a gradual loss of hearing with tinnitus. His audiogram shows a notch at 4 kHz for both air and bone conduction. It is symmetrical on both sides. Which of the following is the cause of his hearing loss?

A 65-year-old diabetic male presented to the clinic with complaints of foul-smelling ear discharge, greenish-yellow in color. On examination, granulation tissue is seen which bleeds on touch. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 63-year-old male farmer visits the outpatient department with the complaint of a non-healing right-sided buccal ulcer for the last 2 months. The ulcer is 3 x 2 cm in size. Examination reveals right-sided cervical lymphadenopathy on neck palpation. Which single investigation should be done to establish the diagnosis?

answers.option: MRI of oral cavity and neck
CT scan of oral cavity and neck

question: A 21-year-old female, who had been in a road traffic accident 4 days ago, presents to the outpatient department with complaints of persistent swelling, bilateral nasal obstruction, and pain. Examination reveals a bulge on both sides of the nasal septum. Her temperature is 100.5 F. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A trumpet player presents with hoarseness and a swelling in the neck which increases in size on coughing and on performing the Valsalva maneuver. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Killian's dehiscence is a potential weak space for the formation of the pharyngeal pouch. Where is it found?

answers.option: Between the glottic and epiglottic folds
Between the base of the skull and the superior constrictor muscle
Between the palatoglossal and palatopharyngeal arches
Between the thyropharyngeus and cricopharyngeus muscles
Between the upper and lower borders of the cricoid lamina

question: A 34-year-old patient presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of sudden onset vertigo, tinnitus, and fluctuating hearing loss. This attack was preceded by a sensation of fullness in the affected ear. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 45-year-old female presents to the emergency department with severely painful nose swelling, malaise, and fever. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
The endolymph is rich in which of the following ions?
Cholesteatoma has the property to destroy the bone. What method of bone destruction is seen in a patient suffering from cholesteatoma?

A 25-year-old Caucasian woman comes to the clinic for evaluation of bilateral, conductive, complete deafness, which started as decreased hearing a year ago and got worse during her pregnancy. There is no history of ear discharge, but she complains of ringing in the ears occasionally. Her brother has also suffered from the same problem for 3 years. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the treatment of choice for glottic carcinoma in situ?
Which of the following artery is known as the artery of epistaxis?
Which of the following is true regarding the surface anatomy of the hypopharynx?

answers.option: It lies opposite the C3-C4 vertebrae
It has three parts; pre-cricoid region, posterior wall and pyriform fossa
Recurrent laryngeal nerve runs in pyriform fossa
It extends from the hyoid bone to the level of cricoarytenoid joint
It is the middle part of pharynx

question: Which of the following is a severe complication of submucous resection of the nasal septum?

A 4-year-old child has been brought to the emergency room with a history of coin-ingestion 6 hours back. The child is in discomfort with the inability to swallow even his own saliva. What is the first step in the management of this case?

A 45-year-old malnourished lady is having difficulty swallowing for the past 6 months. Oral cavity examination revealed smooth tongue and fissures at both angles of the mouth. Which of these diagnostic tests are required in this patient?

A 60-year-old male is complaining of progressive worsening dysphagia for the past 3 months. He also noticed a change in voice and the appearance of a lump in the left upper part of the neck for two weeks. Which of these would you recommend as the first step towards diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presents with deep orbital pain and frontal headache. There is also a history of long-standing chronic sinusitis. On cranial nerve examination, there is palsy of cranial nerves 6, 3, and 4. The vision is normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 20-year-old male had intense pain and itching in his right ear for 5 days. Ear examination revealed wet cheesy material in his right ear. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following organisms is involved in malignant otitis externa?
What is the best treatment for nasopharyngeal carcinoma (stage III)?
Which of the following organisms causes acute epiglottitis?
What is the most common site for leukoplakia in the oral cavity?

A 16-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of severe earache with bleeding from his ear. On otoscopy, the tympanic membrane has red, hemorrhagic bullae. There is a history of upper respiratory tract infection. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 25-year-old healthy female presents in the ENT outpatient department with the complaint of progressive increasing midline swelling of the neck for one year. On examination, it moves with swallowing. What is the most suitable radiological investigation for diagnosis?
A 7-year-old child has undergone a tonsillectomy. Just after a few hours of surgery in the ward. He develops bleeding from the operative site. What is the type of hemorrhage?

A 3-year-old boy was brought with the complaint of unilateral foul-smelling and blood-stained discharge from the nose for the last two weeks. What is the most important condition that should be suspected first?
A 37-year-old man with a history of tobacco chewing presented with painful ulceration in the upper gingiva. The ulcer is surrounded by a keratotic patch at the periphery. What is the diagnosis?

A 62-year-old man came with a squamous cell carcinoma of the cheek on the left side with extension up to the lower gums. What is the most suitable investigation for assessing mandibular involvement in this patient?

answers.option: Plain X-ray face (AP and lateral view)

question: A 55-year-old man presented in the ENT outpatient department with a complaint of right neck swelling with hoarseness. On examination, swelling decreases on manual compression. What is your most probable clinical diagnosis?

A 17-year-old boy presented with nasal obstruction, left cheek swelling, and epistaxis. Lateral X-ray nasopharynx is the showing anterior bowing of the posterior maxillary wall. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 16-year-old boy presented with right-side torticollis, a tender swelling behind the ear, and a fever. He has history of ear discharge for the past 6 years. Examination of the ear revealed a purulent discharge with granulations in the middle ear. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 25-year-old boxer was brought to the emergency room with a history of forceful punch by his opponent on the right side of his nose one and a half hours ago. On nasal examination, external deformity with the left deflected nose is visible. On anterior rhinoscopy left-sided deviated nasal septum without active bleeding is present. How will you manage this patient?

A 12-year-old boy presented with a pre-auricular sinus on the right side with a history of recurrent infection in it. At the time of presentation, it was not infected. What should be the further management?

answers.option: Regular follow-up till the age of 18 years
Regular suction cleaning of the sinus

question: A 31-year-old female presented in the outpatient department (OPD) with the complaint of swelling in the upper part of the neck below the jaw, which becomes painful and increases in size while talking. What is the diagnosis?

A 31-year-old male underwent endoscopic nasal surgery for bilateral nasal polyps. Post-surgery: he started to have clear rhinorrhea which came in drops especially on stooping forward. What is the most likely area which may have been traumatized during surgery?

answers.option: Trauma to perpendicular plate of ethmoid bone
Trauma to cribriform plate of ethmoid bone

question: A 20-year-old boy is complaining of severe sore throat and fever and also difficulty in swallowing for one week. His family physician gave him oral amoxiclave, but his condition further deteriorated. Neck examination revealed bilaterally enlarged and tender lymph nodes. He is also complaining of upper abdominal discomfort. What is the most likely organism that can cause this condition?
A patient came with complaints of dyspnea in the emergency room. The doctor planned a high tracheostomy for his management. Which of the following is the indication of high tracheostomy?
What is the most common congenital neck cyst?
Which of the following structures forms the medial wall of the tympanic cavity?
The basilar membrane is present between which of the following two structures?
Which of the following fluids does the membranous labyrinth contains?
The following molecules move from the endolymph into the stereocilia and depolarise the hair cells. Which of the following ions are involved in the depolarisation of stereocilia?
The compartment of the cochlea contains the organ of Corti. Which compartment of the internal ear contains the organ of Corti?
Which nucleus in the medulla receives the nerve fibers from the organ of Corti?
Which one of the following became the first international research trial on ethics that involves human subjects?
A science that judges human conduct to be right or wrong and to be good or bad is called?
Which of the following is the first complete historic documentation regarding the ethical practice of a medical doctor?
Transmission of auditory signals is performed mainly by inner hair cells rather than outer hair cells of the organ of Corti. Where are the inner hair cells in the organ of Corti present?

The professor of Medicine was reviewing the proformas constructed by the resident trainee. The proforma contained a consent form, patients’ socio-demographics such as name, age, gender, address, and clinical details on the severity of disease, antibiotics used, and the clinical outcome of the patient. The professor is also the principal investigator of this research titled “Effectiveness of antibiotics in the treatment of gastrointestinal infections”. In the given scenario, which research ethics principle is at risk of violation?
A researcher wants to compare the academic scores of final year male and female medical students. Which one of the following statistical tests is the most appropriate to apply?

A researcher assessed the effect of blood glucose levels on the running capacity of students in a marathon race. He made two groups and provided sugar-sweetened beverages to group A and nothing was provided to group B. The researcher measured and compared the running speed of the participants in group A and group B. What could be the most appropriate statistical test in this scenario?

A senior obstetrician claims that the mean hemoglobin level of pregnant women of Karachi is not more than 11.5 g/dl. To test this claim, a community survey is conducted. What could be the most appropriate statistical test for this purpose?
A professor of epidemiology advises his students to take extreme care to avoid bias while taking a sample from the population. Which of the following is the more biased sampling technique?
A professor of medicine asked his students to create pie charts of a chosen variable. Which of the following variables is appropriate for creating a pie chart?

An industrialist asks a public health specialist about the measures he can take, to control noises in the generator factory that he is going to set up. The public health specialist advises on the noise control measures at work according to the hierarchy of control measures. Which of the following is least likely to be advised by the specialist, since it is the lowest measure for control of hazard at workplace?

A 22-year-old girl with no significant past medical history presents with right-sided ear pain and decreased hearing for 1 month and 1 day of decreased right-sided facial movement when smiling and talking. She was diagnosed as the case of acute otitis media. The physician decided to start framycetin sulfate. Framycetin sulfate belongs to which of the following antibiotics?

A 34-year-old male patient reported to the outpatient dental department with a chief complaint of oral discomfort, discharge, inability to open his mouth, and bad breath from the past 2 weeks. Intra-Oral examination showed signs of discharge, a white moss-like appearance, ulcerative lesions of the lips, the base of the tongue, buccal mucosa along with bad breath, and fissures at the angles of the mouth. An immediate diagnosis of oral candidiasis was done. Which of the following drugs can be used in the treatment of oral candidiasis?

A 17-year-old girl, who has a history of asthma and chronic allergic rhinitis presents with a 1-month history of persistent nasal congestion, rhinorrhoea, and headache. Her routine home medications include albuterol, nasal corticosteroids, and antihistamines. The physician decided to start a topical nasal decongestant that acts as an alpha-receptor agonist. Which of the following agents can be used as a nasal decongestant that acts on alpha receptor?

A group of final year medical students is collecting online data from adolescents about their pubertal and sexual issues. They intend to use a self-administered questionnaire, which also contains an inventory to assess anxiety and depression in the same sample. Before proceeding with this research study, whom must they obtain permission from?
Which brainstem structure plays a major role in demonstrating the direction from which the sound originates?

A 45-year-old male smoker presents to the emergency department with complaints of shortness of breath on and off for the last 1 week and a change in voice for 2 months. He also has significant weight loss as he could only swallow semisolid meals with difficulty for the last 3 weeks. What is your most probable clinical diagnosis?

A pus swab for culture and sensitivity is sent for a 28-year-old man who is suffering from atticoantral type of chronic suppurative otitis media (CSOM). What is the most common organism causing this disease?

A 61-year-old chronic smoker presents to the emergency room with noisy and troubled breathing. On examination, recessions are seen of suprasternal, subcostal, intercostal, and supraclavicular spaces. His oxygen saturation is falling. What is the treatment of choice?

A 28-year-old male presents to the outpatient clinic with a complaint of an earache for 3 days. On examination, the tragus is markedly tender and the patient refuses to let the doctor do further examination. What is the likely diagnosis?
What will be the most common presentation after sudden exposure to a sound of 160 decibels?
What will be the most prominent examination finding in a patient with chronic sinusitis?

answers.option: Mucous on floor of nasal cavity

question: Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment option for a T1N0M0 cancer of the larynx?

A 50-year-old male patient has cancer on the lateral border of the tongue measuring 3x2 cm with submandibular nodal involvement of size 3x3 cm. What is the most appropriate treatment option for this patient?

answers.option: Local excision with safe margins and selective neck dissection
Local excision with safe margins and modified radical neck dissection with postoperative radiotherapy
Local excision with safe margins and supraomohyoid dissection

question: A 20-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of pain, redness, and swelling in her right ear for 5 days. She had her ears pierced a week ago. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following difference cannot be discerned in early noise-induced hearing loss?
Which of the following ethical principles protects a participant in a study from being used to achieve the desired outcome without full disclosure?

A 60-year-old male presents to the outpatient clinic with a complaint of hoarseness of voice for 3 months. He has a 20-pack-year history of smoking. Which of the following pathologies is most likely the cause of his symptom?

A 70-year-old male presents to the outpatient clinic with a complaint of a decrease in hearing for 18 months. He is able to hear better in a quiet room. What is the suitable treatment option for this patient?

answers.option: Modern hearing aid and auditory learning

question: Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for a T4N0M0 tumor of the larynx?

A 35-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of dyspnea, easy fatigability, dysphagia, and burning redness around the angle of her mouth. What is the first-line treatment for this patient?

A 66-year-old male presents to the outpatient clinic with a complaint of nasal obstruction for 6 months. He has a history of a surgical procedure carried out for a nasal mass previously. On examination, there is a pale fleshy polypoidal mass in the nasal cavity. There are no nodes palpable. What is the likely diagnosis?
What is the treatment of choice for early lesions of subglottic carcinoma?
Which of the following is the best investigation for Wegener granulomatosis?

A 65-year-old female is referred from the urology department concerning her headache and nasal congestion. She has a medical history of uncontrolled diabetes and chronic kidney disease. On examination, there is a black mass seen in the nose and sinuses. What is the likely diagnosis?
A newborn baby is observed to have a stridor that exacerbates with crying and improves on lying prone. What is the underlying pathology of the likely diagnosis?
What is the normal threshold of hearing in normally hearing individuals?
Which of the following is a suitable description of ethics?

A 9-year-old boy presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of sore throat, fever, and painful swallowing for 2 days. On examination, a grey membrane is seen covering both tonsils. What is the quickest way to confirm the diagnosis?

answers.option: Throat swab for culture and sensitivity

question: A 45-year-old hawker presents to the outpatient clinic with a complaint that his voice gets tired and hoarse at the end of the day. What is the diagnosis of this patient?

A 45-year-old male presents to the outpatient clinic with a swelling of the lower lip. He has a history of a fall one month back. On examination, the swelling is soft and cystic with a bluish color. What is the likely diagnosis?
In which of the following cases a tracheostomy is preferred over endotracheal intubation?
Which of the following is a finding seen in patients with otosclerosis on tympanometry?

answers.option: Dip in bone conduction at 4000 Hz

question: What will be the finding in a patient with incomplete perforation of the right tympanic membrane?

answers.option: Positive rinne test in right ear
Negative rinne test in right ear
Weber test lateralized to the poorer side
Negative rinne test in left ear
Weber test lateralized to the better side

question: A 59-year-old patient presents to the outpatient clinic complaining of lesions on the oral mucosa. His past medical history is significant for diabetes mellitus. On examination, the lesions on the oral mucosa are grey-white in color and they are scraped off easily leaving behind an erythematous mucosa. What is the likely diagnosis of this patient?

A 33-year-old male patient presents to the outpatient clinic complaining of a watery discharge from the nostrils on bending forwards. He recently underwent submucosal resection surgery for deviated nasal septum. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of ear discharge, hearing difficulty, and earache for the past 2 years. On examination, there is a perforation in the tympanic membrane with a pale fleshy mass protruding through the perforation into the external auditory canal. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A person in a restaurant suddenly becomes aphonic while having dinner. He cannot breathe and starts tapping the table as a cry for help. Which immediate step should be taken to save the life of this person?

A 45-year-old male presents with an upward deviation of the angle of the mouth on the left side when asked to show teeth after a right-sided mastoidectomy. What is the possible explanation for this complaint?
What is deafness in the old age group people called?
Which of the following best describes Carhart notch?

answers.option: Dip in the bone conduction curve at 400 Hz
Dip in the bone conduction curve at 2000 Hz
Dip in the bone conduction curve at 4000 Hz
Dip in the bone conduction curve at 200 Hz
Dip in the bone conduction curve at 20000 Hz

question: A 30-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic with a complaint of bilateral decreased hearing for 6 months. She describes that the hearing loss is gradually increasing with time. On examination, the external auditory canal and tympanic membrane are unremarkable. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following tests is used to check for the patency of nasal valves?
Which of the following is a specific test used to diagnose allergic rhinitis?

A 67-year-old patient presents with a white patch on the mucosal surface of his oral cavity. The patient has a history of tobacco chewing for 50 years. On examination, the lesion cannot be scraped off. What is the likely nature of this lesion?
Which of the following is the preferred level of an incision during an emergency tracheostomy?
A 28-year-old patient presents with tinnitus and vertigo for 7 days. He has a past medical history significant for multidrug-resistant tuberculosis. What is the provisional diagnosis of this patient?
Which of the following is the most common complication of submucosal resection (SMR) operation?
A 23-year-old male is treated in the hospital for a septal abscess that he developed after a submucosal resection operation. What other complication he is at risk of developing?
Which of the following is the best imaging modality for the diagnosis of nasopharyngeal angiofibroma?

answers.option: Computed tomography scan with contrast enhancement

question: A 20-year-old male patient presents with a rapidly enlarging mass around the left maxillary region for 3 months. On imaging, a ground glass mass surrounding the maxillary sinus is seen. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the x-ray imaging view of choice for adenoids?

answers.option: Soft tissue lateral view of nasopharynx

question: Which of the following drugs is a beta-lactamase inhibitor that is often administered with penicillins?

A professor is conducting research on a specific antibiotic. He asks a student to provide information about the patients treated with that specific antibiotic. The information included the name, age, ethnicity, and address of the patients. Which ethical principle will be violated if the student provides the information?

A 35-year-old female presents with profuse bleeding from the nose and mouth. Anterior nasal packing is done to stop the bleeding but it does not stop the bleeding. What is the next best step in the management of this patient?

answers.option: Posterior nasal packing with anterior packing
Endoscopic ligation of external carotid artery

question: A 32-year-old female presents with conductive hearing loss for one year. Clinical examination shows a normal and intact tympanic membrane. Which of the following is the most likely possibility?
A 45-year-old male presents with an inability to move his lower lip after a parotidectomy operation. What is the likely injury in this patient?

answers.option: Injury of cervical branch of facial nerve
Facial nerve injury at stylomastoid foramen
Facial nerve injury at internal jugular fossa
Facial nerve injury at facial canal

question: Which of the following is the simplest test for detecting noise-induced hearing loss?
A 9-year-old boy started bleeding from his nose while exercising in school. Which first aid measure will be beneficial in this case?

answers.option: Sitting upright with forward leaning and pinching the nose
Inserting cotton balls in his nostrils
Asking him to lie down with ice packing
Taking him to hospital in a car
Backward leaning and pinching the nose

question: An 8-year-old boy requires treatment for acute suppurative otitis media with antibiotics. Which of the following antibiotics is not effective for this patient?
What type of tympanogram is seen in a patient with otitis media with effusion?

A 67-year-old male patient admitted to the otorhinolaryngology ward is found to have hoarseness and unilateral vocal cord paralysis. He was diagnosed with bronchogenic carcinoma 4 months ago. Which nerve is damaged in this patient?
Which of the following is the maximum safest loudness that a person can be exposed to daily without ear damage according to local guidelines?
A couple with congenital hearing loss is concerned about their newborn child having hearing loss. Which screening test can be done in a newborn child to assess hearing loss?
